page.title: 15A day out with Yuko
page.content: In September 1984 my family at Thorn Farm had Yuko to stay from Japan. We took her to Whitby. First we took her to Whitby Abbey and to the beach and to see Captain Cook's statue and look around the shops. When we go to Whitby Abbey we will go up the 99 steps. When we go to look around shops I would buy something for Yuko. I would buy some flowers and when we go to the beach I would buy Yuko an ice cream. The day centre meets on Wednesday. It starts at 10 o'clock and finishes at 3.30. People have to pay Â£1 to go. They play games chat and have a cup of tea. Then they have their dinner and have a snooze. The day centre is for lonely, house-bound and handicapped people. One afternoon six children and two adults went down to the day centre. When we got there we all had a chat with one of the people there,
